tier.item: I. Case-matching
(8) Er will jemandem schmeicheln, aber sie wissen nicht, [wem/*wen]
he wants someone-DAT to-flatter but they know not whom-DAT/whom-ACC
'He wants to flatter someone, but they don't know whom.'
I. Case-matching
(8) Er will jemandem schmeicheln, aber sie wissen nicht, [wem/*wen]
he wants someone-DAT to-flatter but they know not whom-DAT/whom-ACC
'He wants to flatter someone, but they don't know whom.'
I. Case-matching
Er will jemandem schmeicheln, aber sie wissen nicht, [wem/*wen]
he wants someone-DAT to-flatter but they know not whom-DAT/whom-ACC
He wants to flatter someone, but they don't know whom.
III. Preposition pied-piping
(11) Anna hat mit jemandem gesprochen, aber ich weiss nicht, *(mit) wem.
Anna has with someone spoken but I know not *(with) whom
'Anna spoke with someone, but I don't know who.'
III. Preposition pied-piping
(11) Anna hat mit jemandem gesprochen, aber ich weiss nicht, *(mit) wem.
Anna has with someone spoken but I know not *(with) whom
'Anna spoke with someone, but I don't know who.'
III. Preposition pied-piping
Anna hat mit jemandem gesprochen, aber ich weiss nicht, *(mit) wem.
Anna has with someone spoken but I know not *(with) whom
Anna spoke with someone, but I don't know who.

tier.item: Sluicing constructions in Japanese
(19) Mary-ga nanika-o katta rasii ga,
Mary-NOM something-ACC bought seems but
boku-wa [nani-o ka] wakaranai.
I-TOP what-ACC Q not-know
'It seems that Mary has bought something, but I don't know what.' (Takahashi 1994)

It seems that Mary has bought something, but I don't know what.
(Takahashi 1994)
(20) Mary-ga kubi-ni natta. Boku-wa [naze ka] siritai.
Mary-NOM was fired I-TOP why Q want-to-know
'Mary wsa fired. I want to know why.' (Takahashi 1994)
(20) Mary-ga kubi-ni natta. Boku-wa [naze ka] siritai.

(21) Boku-wa [ _ nani-o (dearu) ka] wakaranai
I-TOP pro what-ACC be Q do-not-know
'I don't know what (it is).' (Takahashi 1994)

(22) Boku-wa [sore-ga nani-o dearu ka] wakaranai

'I don't know what it/that is.'

(23) a. Mary-ga [John-ni nanika-o ageta onna]-ni atta sooda.
Mary-NOM John-DAT something-ACC gave woman-DAT met I-heard
'I heard that Mary met a woman who had given something to John.'

tier.item: (26) John-wa [[otooto-ni nanika-o okutte-ita hito]-o syootai-sita rasii-ga,
John-TOP brother-DAT something-ACC sent person-ACC invited seems but
boku-wa [nani(*-o) ka] siranai.
I-TOP what-ACC Q not-know
'It seems that John invited a person who had sent something to his brother,
but I don't know what.' (Fukaya and Hoji 1999)
(26) John-wa [[otooto-ni nanika-o okutte-ita hito]-o syootai-sita rasii-ga,
John-TOP brother-DAT something-ACC sent person-ACC invited seems but

I-TOP what-ACC Q not-know
'It seems that John invited a person who had sent something to his brother,

(27) John-ga [[dareka-ga naku-sita hon]-o motte-ita ga,
John-TOP someone-NOM lost book-ACC had but
boku-wa [?*dare-ga/?dare ka] wakaranakatta.
I-TOP who-NOM who Q not-knew
'John had a book that someone lost, but I didn't know who.' (Takahashi 1994)

tier.item: (30) *Daremo-ga [[zibun-no sinseki-ga mita] hito]-o sagasiteiru ga,
everyone-NOM self-GEN relative-NOM saw person-ACC looking.for but
boku-wa [[dono zibun-no sinseki-ga] (da)] ka sira-nai.
I-TOP which self-GEN relative-NOM COP Q know-NEG
`Everyonei is looking for a person who hisi relative saw, but I don't know which
relative of hisi.'
